editorialSummary.text: Italian restaurant with a large menu of classic, filling pastas in a compact, no-frills space.

originalText.text: Nice food, but this isn‚Äôt authentic Italian food at all. The pizza was way too doughy and thick. The pasta was alright, good sauce, the soup was good - however, coming from Italy, this place is not really worth the hype in my opinion if you‚Äôre looking for authentic food. Plus, the tables were so small to even fit more than two plates.

originalText.text: This is my all time favorite restaurant. The people are wonderful and the food never disappoints. I have been coming here for years and I am still greeted with the same smile and warmth since prior to the pandemic. I HIGHLY suggest you try the mushroom ravioli and their seafood pastas. My partner also highly enjoyed their chicken Parmesan as they do not skimp out on the chicken. Their sangria is to die for and they have reasonable prices. I also deeply love their lemon sorbet. I also recommend coming for lunch as their deals are very good.

text.text: This is my all time favorite restaurant. The people are wonderful and the food never disappoints. I have been coming here for years and I am still greeted with the same smile and warmth since prior to the pandemic. I HIGHLY suggest you try the mushroom ravioli and their seafood pastas. My partner also highly enjoyed their chicken Parmesan as they do not skimp out on the chicken. Their sangria is to die for and they have reasonable prices. I also deeply love their lemon sorbet. I also recommend coming for lunch as their deals are very good.

originalText.text:
We were in Soho for an appointment nearby. Honestly, I searched for affordable lunch options near me, and this place popped up. We were the first customers for their lunch menu. By the time we left, there were probably 5 or 6 more tables that were occupied.

I do think their $13.95 lunch concept is phenomenal for NYC....let alone Soho. You also receive salad OR soup with it. We opted for salad, which comes with their house made dressing.

My son's carbonara was good as well as my daughter's rigatoni pomodora. My husband ordered tortellini with a creamy sauce. It was tasty, but a bit too heavy for me. My lunch was the most disappointing of the 4. I definitely can make something more appealing at home.

The servers do come to the table often, but sometimes they were a bit brash/abrupt and always trying to upsell you. This place isn't bad... there are just other places to try in a food mecca like NYC.

originalText.text:
Best Italian food I‚Äôve ever had in the entire country.

So fresh and comfort. Unlike any common Italian restaurants that are pretty sour, their ingredients are so fresh and well balanced!!

A must try!
